project.name: jsDataSet
project.description: DataSet (like .Net) made available for javascript and more

DataSet.name: DataSet
DataSet.description: Provides shim for Ado.net DataSet class

DataRow.name: DataRow
DataRow.description: Enumerates possible version of a DataRow field: original, current

DataQuery.name: DataQuery
DataQuery.description:
Provides utility functions to filter data and to create sql condition over database.
Every function returns a function f where:
f ( r, context )  = true if r matches condition in the given context
f( r, context ) = result  evaluated in the given context if f is a computation function
f.isTrue = true if f is always true
f.isFalse = true if f is always false
f ( r, context) = undefined if there is no sufficient data to evaluate f
null fields and undefined fields are all considered (and returned) as null values (so they compare equal)
f.toSql(formatter, context)  = a string representing the underlying condition to be applied to a database.
 formatter is used to obtain details about making the expression, see sqlFormatter for an example
 [context] is the context into which the expression have to be evaluated

DataRowObserver.name: DataRowObserver
DataRowObserver.description: Internal class attached to dataRow model data and used to track object changes

DataRow.name: DataRow
DataRow.description: Provides methods to treat objects as Ado.Net DataRows

sqlFun.name: sqlFun
sqlFun.description: Function with ability to be converted to sql. When invoked gives a result depending on the arguments.

dataQuery.name: dataQuery
dataQuery.description:
Compare function provider to help building conditions that can be applyed both to collections,
 using the returned function as a filter, or to a database, using the toSql() method

AutoIncrementColumn.name: AutoIncrementColumn
AutoIncrementColumn.description: Describe how to evaluate the value of a column before posting it

DataTable.name: DataTable
DataTable.description: A DataTable is s collection of DataRow and provides information about the structure of logical table

OptimisticLocking.name: OptimisticLocking
OptimisticLocking.description:
Manages auto fill of locking purposed fields and evaluates filter for optimistic locking for update
In his basic implementation accept a list of fields to fill. Values for filling are taken from
 environment.

params.name: parentColsName
params.description: array of string

params.name: childColsName
params.description: optional names of child columns

classitems.description:
Created by Gaetano Lazzo on 07/02/2015.
Thanks to lodash, ObjectObserve
Escapes special characters in a string
classitems.name: myRegExpEscape

params.name: str
params.description: the string to be escaped

classitems.description:
Used as a reference to the global object. (thanks lodash)

The `this` value is used if it is the global object to avoid Greasemonkey's
restricted `window` object, otherwise the `window` object is used.
Enumerates possible state of a DataRow: detached, deleted, added, unchanged, modified

Take track of object changes, managing added fields, removed fields, modified fields.
This is called automatically by the ObjectObserver attached to the object
classitems.name: dataRowReactOnChange

classitems.description: Creates a DataRow from a generic plain object, and returns the DataRow
classitems.name: DataRow

params.name: o
params.description: this is the main object managed by the application logic

classitems.description: current value of the DataRow is the object o itself
classitems.name: current

classitems.description: previous values of the DataRow, only previous values of changed fields are stored
classitems.name: old

classitems.description: fields added to object (after last acceptChanges())
classitems.name: added

classitems.description: fields removed (with delete o.field) from object (after last acceptChanges())
classitems.name: removed

classitems.description: State of the DataRow, possible values are added unchanged modified deleted detached
classitems.name: state

classitems.description:
Get the DataRow attached to an object. This method is attached to the object itself,
 so you can get the DataRow calling o.getRow() where o is the plain object
classitems.name: getRow

classitems.description: get the value of a field of the object. If dataRowVer is omitted, it's equivalent to o.fieldName
classitems.name: getValue

params.name: dataRowVer
params.description: possible values are 'original', 'current'

classitems.description: Gets the original row, before changes was made, undefined if current state is added
classitems.name: originalRow

classitems.description: changes current row to make it's current values equal to another one. Deleted rows becomes modified
classitems.name: makeEqualTo

classitems.description: changes current row to make it's current values equal to another one. Deleted rows becomes modified
classitems.name: patchTo

classitems.description: get changes from the ObjectObserver
classitems.name: commit

classitems.description: Makes changes permanents, discarding old values. state becomes unchanged.
classitems.name: acceptChanges

classitems.description: Discard changes, restoring the original values of the object. state becomes unchanged
classitems.name: rejectChanges

classitems.description: resets all change and sets state to unchanged
classitems.name: _reset

classitems.description: Detaches row, loosing all changes made. object is also removed from the underlying DataTable
classitems.name: detach

classitems.description:
Deletes the row. If it is in added state it becomes detached. Otherwise any changes are lost, and
 only rejectChanges can bring the row into life again
classitems.name: del

classitems.description: Debug - helper function
classitems.name: toString

classitems.description:
Gets the parent(s) of this row in the dataSet it is contained, following the relation with the
 specified name

classitems.description: Gets all parent rows of this one
Gets parents row of this row in a given table
classitems.name: getParentsInTable

classitems.description:
Gets the child(s) of this row in the dataSet it is contained, following the relation with the
 specified name
classitems.name: getChildRows

classitems.description: Gets all child rows of this one
Gets child rows of this row in a given table

classitems.description: Get an object with all key fields of this row

classitems.description: Converts a SqlFun into a string
classitems.name: toSql

classitems.description: Check if an object is the null or undefined constant
classitems.name: isNullOrUndefined

return.description: true if o is null or undefined

classitems.description: Adds some useful methods and properties to a function in order to transform it into a sqlFun
classitems.name: sqlFun

classitems.description: returns  a function that given an environment will give the input functions applied to that.
classitems.name: context
example:
if environment = {a:1, b:2} and environmentFunction = function (env){return env.a}
  context(environmentFunction) applied to environment will return 1

classitems.description:
Gets a field from an object. This is a very important function to distinguish between generic strings and
 field names.
classitems.name: field

return.description:
f such that
 f(r) = r[fieldName]
 f.toSql() = 'fieldName' or 'tableName.fieldName' where tableName is specified

classitems.tagname:
transform strings into fields, leaves other things unchanged
For example 'a' becomes f(r)-> r['a'],
 12 is returned unchanged,
 a function is returned  unchanged
classitems.name: autofield

classitems.description: Defines a constant function. The toSql method invokes the formatter.quote function
classitems.name: constant

params.name: K
params.description: is a literal

return.description: f such that f()= k, f.toSql()= formatter.quote(k)

classitems.description: Evaluates an expression in a given context
classitems.name: calc

params.name: expr
params.description: function representing a generic expression

return.description:
expr evaluated in the context r
 undefined are returned as null constant

classitems.description: Check if an expression evaluates to null
classitems.name: isNull

return.description:
f where f(expr) = true if expr evaluates to null or undefined
 f.toSql() = something like '(EXPR is null)' where EXPR is the sql representation of the given expr
f where f(r) = - r. r should evaluate into a number
f where f(r) = not r. r should evaluate into a boolean

classitems.description: Check if the nth bit of expression is set

params.name: expression
params.description: note: this is autofield-ed, so if you can use a field name for it

classitems.description: Check if the nth bit of expression is not set
classitems.name: bitClear

params.name: expression
params.description: note: this is autofield-ed, so if you can use a field name for it

classitems.description: Checks if expr1 is (sql-like) mask, where mask can contain * and _ characters
classitems.name: like

params.name: expr1
params.description: expr1 note: this is autofield-ed, so if you can use a field name for it

params.name: mask
params.description: mask is a string or a function that evaluates into a string

example:
like('a','s%') compiles into (a like 's%')
       like(const('a'),'s%') compiles into ('a' like 's%')

classitems.description:
Evaluates the maximum value of an expression in a table. If any undefined is found, return undefined.
Null are skipped. If all is null return null
classitems.name: max

classitems.description:
Evaluates the minimum value of an expression in a table. If any undefined is found, return undefined.
Null are skipped. If all is null return null
classitems.name: min

classitems.description: Converts a generic expression into an integer
classitems.name: convertToInt

classitems.description: Converts a generic expression into a string
classitems.name: convertToString

params.name: maxLen
params.description: maximum string len

classitems.description: checks if all supplied expression evaluate to truthy values
classitems.name: and

params.name: arr
params.description: array or list of expression

classitems.description:
Compares a set of keys of an object with an array of values or with fields of another object
 values can be an array or an object
classitems.name: mcmp

return.description:
f(r) = true if :
 case values is an array: r[keys[i]] = values[i] for each i=0..keys.length-1
 case values is an object: r[keys[i]] = values[keys[i]] for each i=0..keys.length-1

classitems.description: Compares a set of keys of an object with an array of values or with fields of another object
classitems.name: mcmpLike

return.description:
f(r) = true if  for each non empty field of r:
 case field is a string containing a %: r[field] LIKE example[field]
 otherwise: r[field] = example[field]

classitems.description: returns a functions that does a subtraction
classitems.name: sub

classitems.description: returns a functions that does a division
classitems.name: div

classitems.description: returns a functions that evaluates the sum of a list or array of values given when it is CREATED
classitems.name: add

classitems.description: returns a functions that evaluates the concatenation of a list or array of strings given when it is CREATED
classitems.name: concat

classitems.description: Evaluates the sum of an array of element given at run time
classitems.name: sum

classitems.description:
returns a functions that evaluates the multiply of a list or array of values
If some operand is 0, returns the always 0 function
classitems.name: mul

classitems.description: Create a AutoIncrementColumn
classitems.name: AutoIncrementColumn

params.name: options
params.description: same options as AutoIncrement properties

classitems.description: name of the column that has to be auto-incremented
classitems.name: columnName

classitems.description: Array of column names of selector fields. The max() is evaluating filtering the values of those fields
classitems.name: [selector]

classitems.description:
Array of bit mask to use for comparing selector. If present, only corrisponding bits will be compared,
 i.e. instead of sel=value it will be compared (sel & mask) = value
classitems.name: [selectorMask]

classitems.description: A field to use as prefix for the evaluated field
classitems.name: [prefixField]

classitems.description: String literal to be appended to the prefix before the evaluated max
classitems.name: [middleConst]

classitems.description:
for string id, the len of the evaluated max. It is not the overall size of the evaluated id, because a
 prefix and a middle const might be present
If idLen = 0 and there is no prefix, the field is assumed to be a number, otherwise a 0 prefixed string-number
classitems.name: [idLen=0]

classitems.description: Indicates that numbering does NOT depend on prefix value, I.e. is linear in every section of the calculated field
classitems.name: [linearField=false]

classitems.description: Minimum temporary value for in-memory rows
classitems.name: [minimum=0]

classitems.description: Gets a function that filter selector fields eventually masking with selectorMask
evaluates the function to filter selector on a specified row and column
classitems.name: getSelector

classitems.description: Gets the prefix evaluated for a given row
classitems.name: getPrefix

classitems.description: gets the expression to be used for retrieving the max
classitems.name: getExpression

classitems.description: Cached function that evaluates selector basing on autoIncrement fields
classitems.name: [getSelector]

classitems.description: Custom function to be called to evaluate the maximum value
classitems.name: [customFunction] ( r, {string} columnName, {DataAccess} conn}

classitems.description: DataSet to which this table belongs

Name of the table

classitems.description: Collection of rows, each one hiddenly surrounded with a DataRow object
classitems.name: rows

classitems.name: myKey

classitems.description: Set of properties to be assigned to new rows when they are created
classitems.name: myDefaults

classitems.description: Array of column names
classitems.name: columns

classitems.description: A ordering to use for posting of this table
classitems.name: postingOrder

classitems.description:
Mark the table as optimized / not optimized
An optimized table has a cache for all autoincrement field
classitems.name: setOptimize

classitems.description: Check if this table is optimized
classitems.name: isOptimized

classitems.description: Clear evaluated max cache
classitems.name: clearMaxCache

classitems.description: Set a value in the max cache
classitems.name: setMaxExpr

classitems.description: get/set the minimum temp value for a field, assuming 0 if undefined
classitems.name: minimumTempValue

classitems.description: gets the max in cache for a field and updates the cache
classitems.name: getMaxExpr

classitems.description: Evaluates the max of an expression eventually using a cached value
classitems.name: cachedMaxSubstring

classitems.description:
Evaluates the max of an expression without using any cached value. If len = 0 the expression is treated
 as a number with max(field) otherwise it is performed max(convertToInt(substring(field,start,len)))
Extract a set of rows matching a filter function - skipping deleted rows
classitems.name: select

classitems.description: Extract a set of rows matching a filter function - including deleted rows
classitems.name: selectAll

classitems.description: Get the filter that compares key fields of a given row
classitems.name: keyFilter

classitems.description: Compares the key of two objects

Get/Set the primary key in a Jquery fashioned style. If k is given, the key is set, otherwise the existing
 key is returned
classitems.name: key

classitems.description: Clears the table detaching all rows.
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description: Detaches a row from the table
classitems.name: detach

classitems.description: Adds an object to the table setting the datarow in the state of "added"
classitems.name: add

params.name: obj
params.description: plain object

classitems.description:
check if a row is present in the table. If there is  a key, it is used for finding the row,
 otherwise a ==== comparison is made
classitems.name: existingRow

classitems.description: Adds an object to the table setting the datarow in the state of "unchanged"
classitems.name: load

params.name: obj
params.description: plain object to load in the table

params.name: safe
params.description: if false doesn't verify existence of row

classitems.description: Adds an object to the table setting the datarow in the state of 'unchanged'
classitems.name: loadArray

params.name: arr
params.description: array of plain objects

params.name: safe
params.description: if false doesn't verify existence of row

classitems.description:
Accept any changes setting all dataRows in the state of 'unchanged'.
Deleted rows become detached and are removed from the table
classitems.name: acceptChanges

classitems.description:
Reject any changes putting all to 'unchanged' state.
Added rows become detached.
classitems.name: rejectChanges

classitems.description: Check if any DataRow in the table has changes
classitems.name: hasChanges

classitems.description: gets an array of all modified/added/deleted rows
classitems.name: getChanges

classitems.description: Debug-helper function
classitems.name: toString

classitems.description: import a row preserving it's state, the row should already have a DataRow attached
classitems.name: importRow

params.name: row
params.description: input

classitems.description:
Get/set the object defaults in a JQuery fashioned style. When def is present, its fields and values are
 merged into existent defaults.
classitems.name: defaults

classitems.description: Clears any stored default value for the table
classitems.name: clearDefaults

classitems.description:
creates a DataRow and returns the created object. The created object has the default values merged to the
 values in the optional parameter obj.
classitems.name: newRow

params.name: obj
params.description: contains the initial value of the created objects.

classitems.description: Make childRow child of parentRow if a relation between the two is found
classitems.name: makeChild

classitems.description:
Get/Set a flag indicating that this table is not subjected to security functions in a Jquery fashioned
 style
classitems.name: skipSecurity

classitems.description: Get/Set the name of table  to be used to read data from database in a Jquery fashioned style
classitems.name: tableForReading

classitems.description: Get/Set the name of table  to be used to write data from database in a Jquery fashioned style
classitems.name: tableForWriting

classitems.description: Get/Set a static filter  to be used to read data from database in a Jquery fashioned style
classitems.name: staticFilter

classitems.description: Get/set the ordering that have to be user reading from db
get the list of columns

Get/Set autoincrement properties of fields

params.name: autoIncrementInfo
params.description: //see AutoIncrementColumn properties for details

classitems.description: Get a serializable version of this table. If serializeStructure=true, also structure information is serialized
Get data from a serialized structure. If serializeStructure=true, also structure information is serialized

adds an array of objects to collection, as unchanged, if they still are not present. Existence is verified
 basing on  key
classitems.name: mergeArray

classitems.description: clones table structure without copying any DataRow
classitems.name: clone

classitems.description:
Clones table structure and copies data
method @copy
Gets a filter of colliding rows supposing to change r[field]= value, on  a specified column
classitems.name: collisionFilter

classitems.description: Assign a field assuring it will not cause duplicates on table's autoincrement fields
classitems.name: safeAssign

classitems.description:
check if changing a key field of a row it would collide with come autoincrement field. If it would,
 recalculates colliding rows/filter in accordance
classitems.name: avoidCollisions

classitems.description: Recalc a field to avoid collisions on some rows identified by a filter
classitems.name: avoidCollisionsOnField

classitems.description: Assign a value to a field and update all dependencies
classitems.name: assignField

classitems.description: assign a value to a field in a row and all descending child rows
classitems.name: cascadeAssignField

classitems.description: Gets all autoincrement fields that depends on a given field, i.e. those having field as selector or prefixfield
classitems.name: fieldDependencies

classitems.description:
Re calculate temporaryID affected by a field change. It should be done for every autoincrement field
 that has that field as a selector or as a prefix field
classitems.name: updateDependencies

classitems.description:
Augment r[field] in order to avoid collision with another row that needs to take that value
if field is not specified, this is applied to all autoincrement field of the table
Precondition: r[[field] should be an autoincrement field
classitems.name: calcTemporaryId

classitems.description: This function is called before posting row into db for every insert/update
classitems.name: prepareForPosting

classitems.name: getOptimisticLock

classitems.description:
get/set the activation filter for the relation, i.e. a condition that must be satisfied in order to
 follow the relation when automatically filling dataset from database. The condition is meant to be applied
 to parent rows
Establish if  a relation links the key of  a table into a subset of another table key

Modifies childRow in order to make it child of parentRow. Sets to null corresponding fields if
 parentRow is null or undefined

Gets all relations where the parent table is the key of the hash
relationsByParent['a'] is an array of all DataRelations where 'a' is the parent

Gets all relations where the child table is the key of the hash
relationsByChild['a'] is an array of all DataRelations where 'a' is the child

classitems.name: cascadeDelete

classitems.description: Creates a serializable version of this DataSet
classitems.name: serialize

params.name: serializeStructure
params.description: when true serialized also structure, when false only row data

params.name: filterRow
params.description: function to select which rows have to be serialized

classitems.description: Restores data from an object obtained with serialize().
classitems.name: deSerialize

classitems.description:
merges changes from DataSet d assuming they are unchanged and they can be present in this or not.
If a row is not present, it is added. If it is present, it is updated.
It is assumed that "this" dataset is unchanged at the beginning
classitems.name: mergeAsPut

classitems.description:
merges changes from DataSet d assuming they are unchanged and they are not present in this dataset.
Rows are all added 'as is' to this, in the state of ADDED
It is assumed that "this" dataset is unchanged at the beginning
classitems.name: mergeAsPost

classitems.description:
merges changes from DataSet d assuming they are unchanged and they are all present in this dataset.
Rows are updated, but only  fields actually present in d are modified. Other field are left unchanged.
It is assumed that "this" dataset is unchanged at the beginning
classitems.name: mergeAsPatch

classitems.description: Import data from a given dataset
classitems.name: importData
